node.title: What you need to consider if you're planning to travel overseas with your unvaccinated kids
node.alt: A woman smiles and a child gestures.
node.description: Radhika is travelling to India to visit family and friends after a long time of separation due to border closures. But she's "anxious" about going overseas with her children who are not yet eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine.
node.content:
["Radhika has waited nearly two years for Australia's international borders to open so she can visit her family in India.", "The mother of two\u00a0from Sydney has finally booked a trip for mid-December with her children\u00a0aged five and 11 so they can see their extended family.\u00a0", "But she conceded\u00a0she was \"anxious\" about the holiday because\u00a0her children are not\u00a0eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine yet.", "\"It just means we're going to have to be a lot more cautious and careful when we are\u00a0travelling,\" she said.", "Although\u00a0Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) has provisionally approved the Pfizer vaccine for children aged between five and 11, rollout is not expected to begin until January 10.", "Among the many issues\u00a0Radhika has had to consider\u00a0for travelling during a pandemic is travel insurance.", "She is worried her family might not be covered if someone contracts COVID-19\u00a0and they have to change their travel plans.\u00a0", "So what do you need to consider if you're travelling overseas with unvaccinated kids, now that international borders are open in\u00a0New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT?", "
Weighing up the risks of travelling with unvaccinated kids
", "While children can contract coronavirus, experts say most don't develop\u00a0a severe form of the disease, even if they're unvaccinated, unlike adults or the elderly.\u00a0", "Fellow at the Department of Paediatrics at the University of Melbourne\u00a0Dr Daryl\u00a0Cheng said it was\u00a0up to parents to weigh up the risks and benefits of travelling overseas with unvaccinated children.", "", "
Parents are being advised to get to known the local health systems in the places they're travelling to.(AAP: Paul Miller)
", "\"It's very similar in terms of a discussion about kids going back to child care or school, where they may be exposed to their classmates, or they may be exposed to teachers or parents \u2026\u00a0with potential COVID-19 infection,\" Dr Cheng said.", "Dr Cheng said the best way for parents to prevent\u00a0their unvaccinated children from contracting COVID-19 while overseas was by practising good hand hygiene, wearing a face mask\u00a0and avoiding crowded areas.\u00a0", "\"It may be prudent for children to travel with vaccinated parents, even though they themselves may be unvaccinated.\"", "Dr Cheng\u00a0recommended people educate themselves\u00a0about local health systems before they travel so they know where to go if they need a test or\u00a0their child does catch coronavirus\u00a0and needs medical attention.", "\"If you're travelling to a country where you're not familiar with the testing regime \u2026\u00a0it\u00a0may be prudent to bring along\u00a0available rapid antigen testing that we now have over the counter in Australia,\" he said.", "\"Those kinds of tools may be actually quite helpful to help\u00a0parents and families make a decision as to whether or not they may need to bring their child to a healthcare facility for formal testing.\"", "
Choosing a COVID-safe destination for the family
", "After months being\u00a0locked down in Sydney and navigating remote learning, Hilary and her\u00a0seven-year-old\u00a0daughter have\u00a0planned\u00a0an overseas trip to Fiji for July next year.", "\"I've had like four months of lockdown homeschool, working full-time from home. It was a really stressful time. And I just need something to look forward to and I need a break,\" she said.", "", "
Hilary has planned a trip to Fiji for 2022.(Supplied)
", "The seasoned traveller\u00a0and marketing professional considered flying to the United States, where she is from,\u00a0to see family and friends, but she was worried about high case numbers there and instead picked Fiji.", "\"It just seemed too risky to me to be flying internationally to Chicago or anywhere in the US really, because cases are so high, so I sort of looked around at somewhere that was\u00a0a bit closer to home and\u00a0that had\u00a0higher vaccination rates and lower cases.\"", "She also has a daughter who isn't yet eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine. It's one of the reasons she is\u00a0avoiding travelling to the US.\u00a0", "Hilary strategically planned her overseas trip for the middle of next year, anticipating her daughter would become eligible for a vaccine\u00a0before they leave.", "She's also avoiding staying at an Airbnb to avoid unnecessary contact with others.\u00a0", "\"Because of COVID, I am more risk-averse. Like, I wouldn't actually stay in someone's home \u2026\u00a0now because I don't really know, are they vaccinated?\" she said.", "Hilary said they\u00a0would mostly stick\u00a0to their resort rather than moving around too much.", "
What do you need to look out for in travel insurance?
", "", "
Dean Long says travel insurance may not cover disruptions to travel if someone in your family catches COVID-19.(Accommodation Association of Australia)
", "Overseas travel during a pandemic is\u00a0challenging, so travel experts are urging people to plan carefully, especially if taking unvaccinated children.", "\"It's never been more complex to travel anywhere in the world, let alone within Australia,\"\u00a0Australian Federation of Travel Agents (AFTA) chief executive\u00a0Dean Long told the ABC.", "\"Travel agents will be able to assist them on the major barriers which they're going to be facing.\"", "Those barriers include possible testing,\u00a0quarantine and vaccination requirements for entry into a country, including countries you may have to transit through.", "Mr Long\u00a0said while some\u00a0travel insurance does\u00a0cover your\u00a0medical fees if you catch COVID-19 overseas, many don't necessarily cover the costs of the travel disruptions it may cause.\u00a0", "\"That's definitely a blind spot for a lot of travel products at the moment.\"", "He said families should look closely at the terms and conditions of insurance before signing up and pick the best level of cover, rather than the cheapest.\u00a0", "\"It will be clearly outlined in the\u00a0terms and conditions document from the insurance company about what's included and what's not,\" Mr Long said.", "\"Purchase\u00a0maybe not the lowest priced one, but the one that actually provides the product and service and coverage that you need to protect your family.\"", "Mr Long also recommended\u00a0families set aside money in case they have to pay for COVID-19\u00a0tests overseas.", "", "
